text.0: to you i come with this mine adoration and with a hymn i crave the strong ones favour.
text.1: a hymn that truly makes you joyful maruts suppress your anger and unyoke your horses.
text.2: maruts to you this laud with prayer and worship formed in the mind and heart ye gods is offered.
text.3: come ye to us rejoicing in your spirit for ye are they who make our prayer effective.
text.4: the maruts praised by us shall show us favour maghavan lauded shall be most propitious.
text.5: maruts may all our days that are to follow be very pleasant lovely and triumphant.
text.6: i fled in terror from this mighty indra my body trembling in alarm o maruts.
text.7: oblations meant for you had been made ready these have we set aside for this forgive us.
text.8: by whom the mānas recognize the daysprings by whose strength at the dawn of endless mornings.
text.9: give us thou mighty glory with maruts fierce with the fierce the strong who givest triumph.
text.10: do thou o indra guard the conquering heroes and rid thee of thy wrath against the maruts.
text.11: with them the wise victorious and bestowing may we find strengthening food in full abundance.
